#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Progressive Conservative candidate Jim Chapman , London-Fanshawe
#Text=Tuesday , September 25 , 2007
#Text=Jim Chapman is running for the Progressive Conservative of Ontario in the Ontario provincial election , in the London-Fanshawe riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I believe Ontario is at a crossroads .

#Text=We will elect either a Liberal government pledged to continue a high-tax , high-spend policy that has increased taxes by 33 % over four years , or a Progressive Conservative government that believes there is generally more to solving a problem than throwing money at it .
#Text=I was born and raised in London Fanshawe and when the PC Association invited me to stand for nomination , I accepted and was subsequently acclaimed .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=As a member of the local news media for fifteen years I have been a keen observer of the political process and have studied and written extensively on provincial politics .
#Text=I have known both Dalton McGuinty and John Tory personally for years , and have watched and analysed their development as political leaders .
#Text=I am an effective communicator and a Type A worker , both attributes I believe to be vital to being a successful representative of the people at Queen 's Park .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?
#Text=The biggest challenge to any candidate is voter apathy , brought on by years of broken promises and political bafflegab .
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=My record of public service and advocacy for ordinary people is well-known across the city .
#Text=I do my homework , I know the issues and I have the ability to speak for those who ca n't , or wo n’t speak for themselves .
#Text=I am not afraid to speak truth to power , I ’m not anybody 's yes-man and I get things done ...
#Text=And , I believe the proper job of an M.P.P. is to carry the message of the riding to Queen 's Park , not the other way around .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
